Reviews.Title: “Too small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DrKannan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally placed, but the rooms are too small & there is no place even to open your baggage. The rooms are not worth the price we are paying.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Pauline S
Reviews.Content: We booked with friends same time, same price!!. They got a pleasent room, ours was awful. To small to even unpack a case, no room even for a bedside table or anything to put a case on ,it was grubby, smelly, the aircon did not work, so we asked for another, The next room was bigger however the toilet had overflowed into the room. it was disgusting, Filthy, Wet and an overpowering smell of effluent,(The room boy offered to spray it ?) We asked the manager to come and see it, he point blank refused. The third room we were offered, after over 2 hours of asking for our money back and being refused,Unfortunately we had prepaid with Agoda, we were given an average room at the front of the Hotel, It was fairly noisy, dirty carpets, had an ants nest behind the bed headboard,we still had ants in our clothes when we arrived home, but the bathroom was clean and the complimentary breakfast basic but good and location were the only thing going for this (Hotel) it should really be Backpackers. and that would be a compliment. Receptionist /Manager should be shot he was the worst Hospitality employee I have ever come across, for the rest of the time we were there he ignored us completely. He was impolite and as previously mentioned in another review never never made eye contact,and pretended not to speak English

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LamLha
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, close to underground station and amidst the hustle and bustle of the colorful china town. Rooms well appointed, though really small with tiny bathroom. My room was without a window, but it did not bother me that much as during day time was out sightseeing. Friendly and helpful staff. Good and cheap place to stay in Singapore. Breakfast very limited (cup of coffee, toast with jam and an egg), but enough to kick off your day.

Reviews.Title: “So so experience (3D2N during weekend)”
Reviews.Author: loisloo
Reviews.Content: I was here last weekend for a 3D2N stay with my mum. We checked in on Saturday afternoon, process was quite fast but like what some reviews stated do not feel welcome by the receptionist (a man), no eye contact and no smile. It's not actually a big deal, the problem is, while we are going up to 3rd floor, the minute we stepped out from the lift we heard noise and saw rubbish, ladder, paint brush in front of the lift door. It was a Saturday plus The receptionist did not even bother to inform us during check in. Hotel is not elder-friendly, lift spoiled on Sunday morning and my mother needs to go down by the staircase from 3rd floor. The lift wasn't working until we came back from lunch. An aunty with wheelchair have to wait at the small lobby in front of the lift... Breakfast is simple, hard boiled egg, coffee, toast with strawberry jam and butter, no other choices. There is a yellow warning sign with wet floor and a wet cloth in front of the entrance everyday, Nobody seems to bother to fix it. It is dangerous and not presentable for a boutique hotel. Sleep quallity- bed is okie but pillows are too soft. Location- good location if you like Chinatown, short walking distant to Chinatown MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience in Santa Grand”
Reviews.Author: sjkaranth
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Santa Grand Hotel Chinatown for 4 nights, and had booked a single standard room. Pros: 1. Best location to stay in Singapore (Chinatown) and also just 5 min walk to MRT 2. Very Friendly Staff 3. Decent Breakfast (don't expect a full fledged US breakfast) 4. Rooms' design were more of a boutique style, its different and looks much better. Even the dining area for the breakfast was good. 5. Free internet access and also if you dont have a laptop, you can use the 2 computers in the dining area to browse Cons: 1. Rooms are a bit small for people who are tall and not much space inside the room and also there's no wardrobe to keep your clothes 2. There's no common restroom in the hotel. if you checkout at 12.00 pm on your last day and come back to get your luggage and want to change your clothes, there's no restroom. I would definitely stay in this hotel when i visit Singapore the next time. And also would recommend to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Atmospheric Location”
Reviews.Author: philiip
Reviews.Content: I visited the Santa Grand Hotel in the run up to Chinese New Year. My room overlooked the street below and all the life of crowds, shops and stalls. It was a great location, close to the MRT station and lots of eating options. I would defintely stay here again. The entrance to the hotel is on Temple Street. It occupies the top floor of a 3 storey building. High speed wifi is included, as is breakfast, although this was very simple - toast and hot drinks. I found the staff very welcoming and friendly. The room was clear, very comfortable bed, although the decor won't be to everyone's taste, and is a little tired in parts.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit”
Reviews.Author: Flight17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Santa Grand Chinatown earlier this year, and considering that hotel prices in Singapore are so high, I decided to once again stay at this hotel during my visit to this lovely city. The room was still clean and quiet, although the rates had increased a bit since my previous stay. A cool thing that was new this time around was the two iPads in the breakfast area, where you could surf the internet. I didn't use them that much, since I brought my own laptop and enjoyed the complimentary wifi in the guest room. What I didn't like this time was the attitude of the receptionists. They just didn't seem to enjoy their job, and it was like they took it out on the hotel guests by overlooking them, avoiding eye contact and generally being surly. What can I say? It's still an okay hotel, although I didn't feel as welcome this time around...

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere and avoid the pain”
Reviews.Author: pjnery
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in the Saff on my last trip to Singapore (I come here 3-4 times per year) and found it very agreeable, so was keen to try another Chinatown boutique hotel. Should have stayed with the Saff. I regretted this place from the moment I checked in. The receptionist was surly and charged my stay up front, which should have been a signal to me. Now that I've paid the three nights, I'm less likely to change hotels. When we got to our room it smelled mouldy and was hot. There are only two power points and they are used by the lamp and kettle. So I have to unplug these to use my laptop, charge a phone or iron. I complained about all these things and a smiling attendant showed me another room - exactly like this one but reversed layout. But there's barely enough room to turn around so it's something like a Laurel and Hardy comedy skit to iron - particularly with the equipment they gave me. When I asked for an iron I was told there is a $10 dollar deposit for the iron and board. I doubt they cost that much, and what am I going to do - steal it? I had to fight the board to get it to stand above knee height. And the iron has no steam. Haven;t seen one of those in 30 years or more. I was tempted to go out and buy one, and a power strip to give me power points. The attendant must have felt for me as she waived the deposit. Still I think I'd be doing them a favour to break it. The shower is a small capsule so small that my elbows bang the sides when shampooing. And the closet has all of four hangers in it. With our luggage and the ironing board up it's an obstacle course in here. I've been here all of 5 hours and it keeps getting worse. Please let these days pass quickly. Out of the hundreds of hotels I've stayed in, this has to rank in the top 3 worst already.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: rnmom1234
Reviews.Content: The family loved this hotel because the staff were all very friendly,approachable and helpful! Breakfast,water and the Coffee and chocolate drinks were given generously. Wi Fi were also available! We will definitely recommend this to anyone we know will visit Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: SandyChang
Reviews.Content: Hi, I just want to say thank you very much. I have finally got my pink bag back. But thank you for looking over the camera and reassuring that it must be on the taxi so we had less to worry about. Thank you for your time. We felt much welcomed and we always enjoyed our breakfast. Thank you. (By the way, there were some ants crawling around the phone/kettle stand since the first night.) -Sandy

Reviews.Title: “Great value and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Flight17
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotel prices are, unfortunately, through the roof. It's not easy finding a centrally located and reasonably priced hotel in this exciting city. After spending hours and hours doing research, I chose Santa Grand Hotel in Chinatown. The good things: - The room rate! - The location was perfect, only a couple of minutes away from the MRT station - Free WiFi in the rooms - The room was clean, and I was supplied with drinking water, a toothbrush and slippers on a daily basis The bad things: - Even though I booked a Superior Room, it was tiny. I wasn't really surprised, after reading some of the reviews here on TripAdvisor. Besides, I didn't really spend that much time in the room, besides sleeping. I would probably stay here again, if I go back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JinHK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a very last-minute business trip because all the other hotels I would have chosen were full due to a big conference in town. Next time I'd try to plan ahead more and get a better room somewhere else. The location is the only selling point, in the heart of Chinatown near the MRT and a short walk to Maxwell Street Food Centre. And at least it offers free WiFi in-room. But that's about it. For all guests, the bed was the most uncomfortable I can remember in a hotel in a long time and the linens weren't as clean as you'd expect. The smoke detector features a green light that shows it's working but also illuminates the room when all the other lights are off and shines right in your eyes as you try to sleep. I've never slept so poorly in a hotel. Business travelers will also note that, at least in my room, the seat at the desk didn't have a back -- it was really an upholstered bench -- and plugs for a laptop and various chargers are few and far between. The decor of the public areas looks like an attempt at boutique-style redecoration gone horribly wrong. This continues in the rooms, where the effect of a nicely renovated bathroom is undermined by a natty carpet; an attempt at antique-ish furniture doesn't compensate for an armoire too small to be usable for hanging suits; and an attempt at a suave upholstered Victorian headboard ends up looking more like what you'd expect in a bordello because it's shabby. Especially for the price I paid relative to true "discount" hotels I could have booked, this one fell far short.

Reviews.Title: “very dirty, bad service”
Reviews.Author: XXXXXX_11
Reviews.Content: My first impression when I entered the room was that the room is very tiny, but I can live with that. When I looked a second time however the room was very dirty, hairs on the floor and in the bad, dust on the everything. When I complained at the reception they send a cleaning lady to the room immediately, however in 10 minutes time there was little improvement (I mean closing the edsheets so I do not see the hair does not count as cleaning) so After asking again the bad sheets were replaced. Since I was already up for more than 24 hours I just wanted to sleep the remaining cleaning could be done later, however after 2 hours sleep I saw insects walking around, not only on the floor but also on my clothes. This was it I checked out within 3 hours of checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Serves the Needs of Travelers Ver y Well”
Reviews.Author: wbsk
Reviews.Content: This place deserves some love -- extremely good location in the middle of Chinatown near two lines of public transport, friendly and helpful staff members and nicely outfitted rooms. My husband & I spent one night here on a layover and had a good experience all the way around. We had originally booked for two nights but because of problems with our flight from Cambodia only made it for one. I explained out situation and they thankfully were willing to refund me for one night of stay - nice! Yes, the rooms are small, but you're in Singapore! You should be out & about, not hanging out in your room! The decor is fun, the bathroom is well put together and the bed is pretty comfortable. All in all, a great choice in a city loaded with tiny overpriced and dirty hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Singapore standard”
Reviews.Author: muuuuu
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels are generally expensive, so this was the best deal I could get. The room is of course small. The bathroom is also small that I always made the toilet, the sink and everything else wet everytime I took a shower (but the bathroom is quite cute!). Not much complain about the size though, because it's Singapore after all. The location was great. The night market is just downstairs. The street full of Chinese food is just 3 minutes away. The nearest elevator to MRT in Smith street is about 5-minutes walk. The famous bak-hwa shops were in walking-distance as well so it was very easy to buy souvenirs and food just before we leave Singapore. The free wi-fi is a bit strange. I can connect alright, but it disconnected itself after a while. Sometimes I can connect but it doesn't work (I don't know why but it doesn't assign me a DNS address). I had to retry and reconnect about 30 times each time I want to check my mail. The problem I had was the air conditioner. There was water dropping from the air conditioner to our bed. I complained and they checked it, but they said that it cannot be fixed, and there are no other available rooms. So they moved the bed a bit so that the water won't drop on the bed. However, they didn't change the sheet on that day, so my mom had to sleep with her head on the wet part of the sheet. I was pissed on the first day because of this, but there was no other problem on the next two days. If it wasn't for the same promo price, I don't think I would stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “good deal for a weekend trip to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ghoulies_2
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, a queen sized bed pretty much occupied all the space in the room. It's not possible to look out or open the windows. Bathroom is also extremely small (no shower cabinet). Anyway since the hotels in Singapore as quiet pricey and you most likely don't go there to hang out too much in your hotel room i think this hotel is quiet a good deal. The price is considered cheap by Singaporean standards and the location is not bad at all. You have less than 5 minutes walking distance to the Chinatown MRT station and you only need to cross 1 small road which has traffic. The MRT in Singapore is very convenient and reliable and you are just a few stations away from famous Orchard road (however need transit) where hotel prices are likely to be the double of Santa Grand. Chinatown itself was a bit disappointing as it seems to die completely around 10-11pm, nightlife there seemed almost non-existent. The hotel has a cafe/restaurant on the second floor (Yum Cha) I can definitely recommend this hotel if you dont mind the small room and taking the MRT to all the interesting spots in Singapore. Remember Singapore is not that big, it doesn't take long to travel with the MRT or taxi and is it really worth to spend twice as much or even more for your hotel just to avoid taking a 15 minutes ride?

Reviews.Title: “Average room/hotel, good location and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: asuan
Reviews.Content: Saw previous reviews and with the promotion we thought we'd try it out. The room was small as expected, (yes it was right in the middle of chinatown but MRT public transport is about 15 mins walk) Cleaness of the room could be improved - the carpet was dirty with marks, on day 2 there was a cockroach in the room (I wish I had taken a photo of it rather than setting it free in the hallway as I did not want to be near to it). The toilet was tiny which meant you would have to shower 'over' the toilet, making the bathroom wet everywhere and drying your feet on the filthy carpet! During our stay there so happened to be other families with children and they were roaming around the hall way in the early mornings, so quality of sleep was unfortunately not as good as we'd like it to be. The free wifi did not work for us - it kept saying connection failed (and we tried it on 3 different devices). We did not notify the hotel staff of this though as we only stayed for a couple of days and left it at that. The hotel was cheap compared to many others, however to us it was not worth the money as seeing what we get for it, we should've spent a bit more to get a clean and decent room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: BostonEsan
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Singapore in the next couple of months and you are looking for a well-priced and excellent located place to call home this is your place. The hotel just opened and it's right in the middle of Chinatown. They are also currently running a grand opening promo at 150 SGN dollars a night. For this price the place can't be beat. The rooms are small but they are very clean and comfortable. With chinatown at your steps you have tons of delicious restaurants and cheap shops to explore throughout the day and night.
